meanings.definition: To use or expend carelessly or extravagantly
meanings.sent1: She wast all her money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: He wast his time playing video games instead of studying.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wast all the nuts in one day!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter wast like a waterfall, flowing freely and abundantly.
meanings.sent5: The careless wast of resources led to a shortage in supplies.

meanings.definition: To fail to use or take advantage of
meanings.sent1: If you wast this opportunity, you may regret it later.
meanings.sent2: They wast the chance to learn a new skill by not attending the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The cat wast the perfect chance to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: His potential wast like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: Don't wast your talent; showcase it to the world!

meanings.definition: Waste material or substances that are no longer useful or required
meanings.sent1: The factory disposed of its wast in an environmentally friendly manner.
meanings.sent2: The landfill was full of household wast and discarded items.
meanings.sent3: The wast from the kitchen compost bin attracted curious insects.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building was filled with wast from past construction projects.
meanings.sent5: Recycling helps reduce the amount of wast that ends up in landfills.
